_meanings:
{@--1@} The
world, a division of the universe;
(roughly speaking there are three
{%lokas%} {#svarga, pfTvI#} and {#pAtAla#}, but 
according to fuller classification the {%lokas%}
are fourteen, seven higher regions
rising from the earth one above the
other, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} {#BUrloka, Buvarloka, svarloka#}, 
{#maharloka, janarloka, taparloka#}, and {#satyaloka#} or
{#brahmaloka#}; and seven lower regions,
descending from the earth one 
below the other; {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} {#atala, vitala#}, 
{#sutala, rasAtala, talAtala, mahAtala#} and {#pAtAla#}).

{@--11@} <ab>Ved.</ab>
Open space; space, room. (In 
compounds {#loka#} is often translated by
‘universally’, ‘generally’, 
‘popularly’; as {#lokavijYAta#}; so {#°vidvizwa#}).

‘love of 
mankind’, universal love, general 
benevolenee, philanthropy.

‘another world’, the next world, future
life; <ls>R. 1. 69</ls>; <ls n="R.">6. 45</ls>; {#lokAMtaraM gam#}.
{#prAp#} &c. ‘to die.’

<ab>N.</ab> of a mythical mountain that
encircles the earth and is situated
beyond the sea of fresh water which
surrounds the last of the seven 
continents; beyond {#lokAloka#} there is
complete darkness, and to this side
of it there is light; it thus divides
the visible world from the regions
of darkness; {#prakASaScAprakASaSca#} 
{#lokAloka ivAcalaH#} <ls>R. 1. 68</ls>;  
{#lokAlokavyAhataM GarmarASeH SAlInaM vA DAma nAlaM#} 
{#prasartuM#} <ls>Śi. 16. 83</ls>; <ls>Mv. 5. 10</ls>, <ls n="Mv. 5.">45</ls>; (for
further explanation see Dr. 
Bhāṇḍārkar's note on l. 79 of  
<ls>Māl. 10</ls>th Act.).

the 

visible and the invisible world.

common practice, popular
or general custom, ways of the
world; {#api SAstrezu kuSalA#} 
{#lokAcAravivarjitAH#} <ls>Pt. 5. 43.</ls>

a 
materialist, an atheist, a follower of
Cārvāka.

materialism, 
atheism; (for some account see the first
chapter of the 
Sarvadarśanasamgraha).

{1} a 
proverb, popular saying; <ls>Pt. 1. 371.</ls>
{2} common talk, public opinion.

{1} a troublesome or wicked man, the
curse of mankind.

a period or
age of the world.

a
song handed down among people.

a particular
division of the world.

the general or 
usual way, the universally accepted
way.

general rumour, current report, 
popular talk.

{2} differing from
the world, eccentric, singular.
promoting the welfare of the world.

{3} worldly 
existence, career in life; <ls>Māl. 4</ls>, <ls n="Māl.">6.</ls>

disliked
by men, generally or universally 
disliked.

{1} a mode of 
proceeding prevalent in the world.

{1} the way of the
world, a custom prevalent in the
world.

general practice or way
of the world.

{1} existence or
conduct of the universe, worldly 
existence; the stability or permanence of
the world; <ls>Bh. 2. 22.</ls>

world-derided,
the butt of general ridicule.

beneficial to mankind or to the
world.
